mFuelInventoryHandler.description: Maintainer of the active storage component for this actor. Use this to get the active inventory component.

mFuelClasses_DEPRECATED.description: Fuel classes this machine can run on. Leave empty if it does not run on fuel.

mDefaultFuelClasses.description: Fuel classes this machine can run on. Leave empty if it does not run on fuel.

mAvailableFuelClasses.description: Current fuel classes of the generator, useful for runtime adding of fuel classes

mFuelResourceForm.description: The form of resource this generator is allowed to accept. ie. SOLID or LIQUID

mRequiresSupplementalResource.description: Does this generator require a secondary NON fuel source to generate power?

mSupplementalResourceClass.description: Required secondary resource class to continue with generation. Tex. Water. Leave empty if none is desired

mSupplementalToPowerRatio.description: The quantity of supplemental resource to consume per megawatt of power produced

mCurrentFuelAmount.description: Amount left of the currently burned piece of fuel. In megawatt seconds (MWs).

mCurrentSupplementalAmount.description: Amount left of the currently loaded supplemental resource. In Liters ( 1 Liquid inventory item = 1 Liter )

mHasFuelCached.description: Used so clients know how if they have available fuel or not. Could be removed later if we start syncing the production indicator state

mHasSupplementalCached.description: Like the mHasFuelCached - Used to notify clients if there is enough supplemental resource available

mCurrentFuelClass.description: Type of the currently burned piece of fuel.

mPowerProduction.description: Amount of power this generator produces in MW.

mLoadPercentage.description: Current load of this generator in the range [0,1].

mPowerInfoClass.description: Class to use for the power simulation on this factory, this is only used if the building has any FGPowerConnectionComponent attached.

mOnHasPowerChanged.description: So that you can listen for when power has changed

mOnHasProductionChanged.description: So that you can listen for when production has changed

mNumCyclesForProductivity.description: How many cycles back do we base the productivity on

mCanChangePotential.description: Set this to true if we want this building to be able to change the production rate potential with the "Slider of Potential"

mCurrentPotential.description: This is the current potential (overclock, overcharge) of this factory [0..N]

mPendingPotential.description: When ever a production cycle is completed we set the current potential to this value

mMinPotential.description: You can never set the potential to less than this when playing

mMaxPotential.description: You can never set the potential to more than this when playing

mMaxPotentialIncreasePerCrystal.description: When the player adds another crystal in the inventory we unlock even more potential

mFluidStackSizeDefault.description: Item stack size Enum to use as base for how much fluid a Liquid / Gas Item descriptor can be stored on an index in an inventory

mFluidStackSizeMultiplier.description:
Scalar for multiplying the default Stack Size for Fluid Inventory Slots ( 1 is default. 2 == 2
  FluidStackSize )

mIsProductionPaused.description: The player is able to toggle if production should be paused or not

OnReplicationDetailActorCreatedEvent.description: Event for when ReplicationDetailActors are created. Will only be dispatched if this buildable inherits from the ReplicationDetailActorOwnerInterface.

mInventoryPotential.description: The input we place a crystal in to unlock the potential

mSignificanceBias.description: A bias to the significance value

mEffectUpdateInterval.description: How often effect update should update

mCurrentProductivity.description: A replicated compressed version of the productivity

mIsProducing.description: Are we producing? Do not set this manually, some delegates and other stuff might not get triggered then.

mHasPower.description: If building has power, for more details about the circuitry see mPowerInfo.

mAddToSignificanceManager.description: Indicates if the factory should be handled by significance manager

mSignificanceRange.description: The range to keep the factory in significance

mHologramClass.description: The hologram class to use for constructing this object.

mDisplayName.description: The human readable display name of this object.

mDescription.description: The human readable description of this object.

mHighlightVector.description: Vector used to determine highlight effects location

mFactoryTickFunction.description: Controls if we should receive Factory_Tick and how frequent.

mMaterialNameToInstanceManager.description: Map of colorable mesh materials to their respective colored factory material instance manager

mPrimaryColor.description: The primary color of this buildable

mSecondaryColor.description: The primary color of this buildable

mColorSlot.description: The color slot of this buildable

mBuildEffectTemplate.description: What build effect to use when building this building

mDismantleEffectTemplate.description: What build effect to use when dismantling this building

mBuildEffectInstignator.description:
Used to sync and start build effect on buildings when created, but not after creation. Set's to true when creating a building, turns off in the construction effect finish play.
[DavalliusA:Mon/01-04-2019] this is sett to null in default. If it's non null, we expect the build effects need to play.

mBuildEffectSpeed.description: Build effect speed, a constant speed (distance over time) that the build effect should have, so bigger buildings take longer

mForceNetUpdateOnRegisterPlayer.description: Whether or not this building should use ForceNetUpdate() when a player registers/unregisters from it.

mDidFirstTimeUse.description: If this building should show highlight before first use, save when it has been shown

mShouldShowHighlight.description: Should we show highlight when building this building

mBuildingID.description: The building ID this belongs to.

mInteractWidgetClass.description: The widget that will present our UI.

mIsUseable.description: If you can interact with this buildable.

mNetConstructionID.description: ID given from server when constructed. Has not been assigned a value by server if 0.

mBuiltWithRecipe.description: Recipe this building was built with, e.g. used for refunds and stats.

mBuildTimeStamp.description: Time when this building was built

mCachedShapeComponent.description: Caching the shape component once we have gotten it
